talk.author: did:plc:usgujwo5stxxyvwtib42pg6t
talk.utter: Isn’t Trump the only post-war incumbent to lose without having drawn a primary challenge?

talk.author: did:plc:edlwwxqwxftqssqyalatkuwx
talk.utter: Sure, but that's baseball fun facts. n=3 doesn't mean anything.

talk.author: did:plc:usgujwo5stxxyvwtib42pg6t
talk.utter: We’re admittedly talking about a small sample size, but you’re making the claim that not all weak incumbents draw a primary challenger and we have exactly one case where that happened.

talk.author: did:plc:usgujwo5stxxyvwtib42pg6t
talk.utter: We’re admittedly talking about a small sample size, but you’re making the claim that not all weak incumbents draw a primary challenger and we have exactly one case where that happened.

talk.author: did:plc:edlwwxqwxftqssqyalatkuwx
talk.utter: And exactly one where a weak incumbent did draw a credible primary challenge.

talk.author: did:plc:usgujwo5stxxyvwtib42pg6t
talk.utter: Well, no, there are at least two (1980 and 1992). I would argue 1968 also counts.
